intro: Cerastium trichogynum, commonly known as the hairy cinquefoil, is a low-growing perennial plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Rosaceae family and is characterized by its prostrate or ascending stems covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, white or pinkish flowers that bloom in early spring, typically from April to June. Its leaves are alternate, ovate to lanceolate, and often have a hairy texture. Cerastium trichogynum thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in woodlands or along stream banks.
